etymology.description: Hand 又 holding a tool (later stylized to resemble phonetic 卜), depicting “to hit”.
etymology.interpretation: Shows a right hand grasping an implement used to strike, capturing the action of tapping or hitting. Later stylization made the implement look like 卜, a graphic accident rather than a link to divination or to characters that only look similar.

examples.chinese: 古籍中偶见攴(古籍中偶見攴)，表示用棍轻敲(表示用棍輕敲)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔjí zhōng ǒu jiàn pū, biǎoshì yòng gùn qīng qiāo.
examples.english: In old texts, one occasionally sees 攴, meaning to tap lightly with a stick.

examples.chinese: 这个偏旁叫攴字旁(這個偏旁叫攴字旁)，多与打、教等义有关(多與打、教等義有關)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège piānpáng jiào pū zìpáng, duō yǔ dǎ, jiào děng yì yǒuguān.
examples.english: This side component is called the ‘攴’ radical and often relates to meanings like hitting or teaching.
